column4: Whats the best proggy to sound edit an mp3 sound to dampen or even remove the thud thud thud of the drums?
id give audacity a try
audacity is a sound manipulation program so if you can use it properly im sure it will achieve what you want
if its a module to load run: gksudo gedit /etc/modules
and add it there
you can add all the modules to be loaded there
flash is proprietary format to Adobe so a flash creator would need to be made by adobe to be useful, there may be a best effort one some place
they will run it fine, hardware is discussed in offtopic or #hardware
this channel is for people having issues with ubuntu only
the ubuntu community support is pretty decent
afaik, its the same. tbf, if all you need is a file sharing server then any distro will do
what sort of server is it?
if you are comfortable with debian server then i'd say stick with it
bum may be able to help but its a bit weird now that things are changing
it can be used as such, yes
remember to put &s on the ends of commands so the system wil still run while the app runs in the background
damn...I need & at the end of commands in that file??? It's not a scriptfile???
it is pretty much a script file but without the whole system will sit until the command finishes
sure but as I said, if yu dont background a command the system will wait until it completes
try:  lsof | grep something       change 'something' to something like the mount point or somesuch, also make sure your pwd is NOT in the mount point as this will lock it too
I suggest a clean install. You will get a much cleaner OS and you will get there faster
problem with a clean install is that this is an openvz template we are talking about that is configured to run Xvnc and I'm not sure I can configure xvnc in a fresh install since I'm not vnc savvy
